He placed the ring back on his finger, pushing it down until it reached the knuckle. Then he turned to face the one photo they had left displayed - a framed picture of them laughing together at some long-forgotten picnic. Her smile was radiant, her eyes sparkling with life. He remembered that day vividly; it seemed like another lifetime now.

Tonight was supposed to be their anniversary. They'd planned it years ago, marking the date on the calendar with a red heart. But she wasn't here to celebrate. She wasn't anywhere.

Despair weighed heavy in his chest as he looked around at the remnants of their life together - empty wine bottles gathering dust, half-read books left open on tables, her favorite cooking apron still hanging by the stove.
